article.headline: Army 78, Holy Cross 48
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Kevin Hamilton had 14 points and Holy Cross placed five players in double figures to defeat Army 78-38 on Saturday. Hamilton scored 10 points in the first for Holy Cross (9-12, 3-5 Patriot) as the Crusaders put the game away on the first half. Holy Cross led 40-10 at halftime. Army (5-15, 2-6), was unable to solve the Holy Cross defense and only shot 16 percent in the first half, while the Crusaders scored 16 first-half points off Army turnovers. Travis Owsley led Army with 9 points. Holy Cross snapped a three-game losing streak with the win. Holy Cross took a 9-3 lead to open the game and broke it open with an 11-0 run. Hamilton hit a 3 and Torrey Thomas converted two 3-pointers in the run. Hamilton and Jave Meade both hit 3-pointers as HC went on a 17-4 run over the final 8:51 of the half. Holy Cross, which outrebounded Army 41-31, never allowed Army to make any type of run in the second half and took a 53-17 lead with 15:15 remaining.
